critique: The document is an executive order regarding the blocking of Iraqi assets. As the President, the primary emotions I want to elicit are a sense of confidence in the government's ability to handle the situation and a sense of security that the US is acting in accordance with international law. There might also be a desire to project an image of strength and resolve. The order itself is very legalistic and formal, so it doesn't directly evoke strong emotions. However, the context of the order (Iraq, UN resolutions) suggests a backdrop of potential fear and anger related to the conflict. The order aims to alleviate fear by demonstrating control and adherence to international norms. It also aims to project strength, which can be associated with joy (in the sense of national pride) or fear (in the sense of deterring adversaries). Disgust might be present due to the actions of the Iraqi government that led to the sanctions. Surprise is unlikely to be a major factor.
